channel.title: meta on Nathan R. Yergler
channel.description: Recent content in meta on Nathan R. Yergler

item.title: The Habit
item.description: A mentor, Naomi, once told me “it’s more fun to write programs that help you write programs than it is to write programs”.

item.title: Nostalgia
item.description: I read that 2018 was the final year of Open Source Bridge.

item.title: Debugging my Creative Process
item.description: I’ve been taking print making classes this year, and have really enjoyed exploring something new.

item.title: Perfection is not an option
item.description: My friend Andy, a successful organizational development consultant, moved to Ohio last year to pursue an MFA in playwriting.

item.title: Meta: What’s up with all the Reading?
item.description: So far this year, I’ve published seven posts with the tag “reading “.

item.title: The Meta Project Stack
item.description: I guess I’m not the only one who gets distracted by meta projects , although Dave’s appear to actually be productive tangents.

item.title: Meta
item.description: My friend and colleague Vern used to joke that it was more fun to write code to help you write code than it was to actually write code.
